result.execSummary:
The defendant Lajuan K Lipsey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lajuan K Lipsey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lajuan K Lipsey was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
JOC amended to reflect assessment of MISD costs (not FEL costs).

Pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge to be paid within 90 days of today's date. failure to pay is civil judgment.

Time Served Disposition.
Court will grant expungement if defendant pays all court costs, fees, and surcharges within 90 days of today's date.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lajuan K Lipsey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Vacate Judgment $518.00, JOC was Amended. JM
Felony court costs were assessed in error.  Changed to Misdemeanor costs this date.  Warrant fee also added.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of RETURN ON WARRANT commencing MAY 8, 2015 received and filed. (6 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to MILWAUKEE COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPT.
Court will grant a petition for expungement if defendant pays all court costs, fees and surcharges within 90 days of today's date.

Defendant Lajuan K Lipsey in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Lajuan K Lipsey in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

AS TO COUNT 2:   Court ordered defendant to serve 62 days in the House of Correction, with 62 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges to be paid within 90 days of today's date.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Pay the DNA surcharge within 90 days of today's date.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Court will grant a petition for expungement if defendant pays all court costs, fees, and surcharges within 90 days of today's date.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Lajuan K Lipsey in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Lajuan K Lipsey in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 2 (MISDEMEANOR):    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.   Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 dismissed outright.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

- NO FILE IN COURT -
Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Lajuan K Lipsey not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court "administratively" ordered the outstanding bench warrant WITHDRAWN.

Court addressed bail:  Court REINSTATED the $1,000.00 signature bond with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Conditions of release remain as previously ordered.  (Signature bond was not previously forfeited.)

Case adjourned to 06-29-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

No appearances.

Court received notice that the defendant was discharged from Justice Point on 04-13-2015.
Court AFFIRMS the bench warrant issued on 04-06-2015.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (Missed telephone contact.)
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith appeared TELEPHONICALLY on behalf of the defendant.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a scheduling conference today.
Defendant does NOT appear.
Statements made.
Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

**No bail forfeited.

Defendant Lajuan K Lipsey in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Paul Hauer for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/17/15.
HMP

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
No driving without a valid license.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Lajuan K Lipsey in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  
Defendant Lajuan K Lipsey in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to the Misdemeanor Count.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
